intro: Acisanthera pulchella, commonly known as the pretty sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Acisanthera pulchella is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
